title: Correcting a filed document
context: [ยง425E-207]** Correcting a filed document.** (a) A domestic or foreign limited partnership may correct a document filed by the director if the document: (1) Contains an incorrect statement; or (2) Was defectively executed, attested, sealed, verified, or acknowledged. (b) A document is corrected: (1) By preparing a certificate of correction that: (A) Describes the document, including its file date or attaches a copy of it to the certificate; (B) Specifies the incorrect statement and the reason it is incorrect or the manner in which the execution was defective; and &copy; Corrects the incorrect statement or defective execution; and (2) By delivering the certificate to the director for filing. &copy; A certificate of correction shall be effective as of the effective date of the document it corrects; provided that the certificate shall be effective when filed: (1) For the purposes of section 425E-103&copy; and (d); and (2) As to persons relying on the uncorrected record and adversely affected by the correction. [L 2003, c 210, pt of ยง1]
